Package gov.sandia.geotess

Class GeoTessPosition

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.sandia.geotess.GeoTessPosition
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GeoTessPositionLinear, GeoTessPositionNatualNeighbor
    public abstract class GeoTessPosition
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages information about a single point at an arbitrary position in a GeoTessModel. It supports interpolation of Data at the position it represents, using either linear or higher order interpolation. When interpolating data, the data in a number of surrounding Profiles are first interpolated in the radial dimension at each of the vertices. Then those values are interpolated in the geographic dimensions. Both linear and higher order interpolation schemes are supported. With linear interpolation the vertices of the triangle containing the position and the 3 interpolation coefficients calculated during the triangle walking algorithm are used to interpolate data. For higher order interpolation, cubic splines are used to interpolate data along radial profies and then the Natural Neighbor interpolation algorithm (Sibson, 1980, 19821) is implemented to interpolate data in the geographic dimensions.

    GeoTessPosition is not thread-safe in that it's internal state is mutable. The design intention is that single instances of a GeoTessGrid object and GeoTessData object can be shared among all the threads in a multi-threaded application and each thread will have it's own instance of a GeoTessPosition object that references the common GeoTessGrid + GeoTessData combination.

    Sibson, R., (1980) A Vector Identity for the Dirichlet Tessellation, Proc. Cambridge Philosophical Society, 87, 151-155.

    Sibson, R. (1981). "A brief description of natural neighbor interpolation (Chapter 2)". In V. Barnett. Interpreting Multivariate Data. Chichester: John Wiley. pp. 21-36.

    • Field Detail

      • classCount

        public final int classCount

      • unitVector

        protected double[] unitVector
        The earth-centered unit vector that corresponds to current position.

      • radius

        protected double radius
        Radius of current position, in km.

      • threeDVector

        protected double[] threeDVector
        The earth-centered unit vector that corresponds to current position.

      • earthRadius

        protected double earthRadius
        Radius of the earth's ellipsoid at the current position.

      • layerRadii

        protected gov.sandia.gmp.util.containers.arraylist.ArrayListDouble layerRadii
        An array of length nLayers+1, where layerRadii[i] is the radius of the bottom of layer i. The last (extra) element is the radius of the top of the last layer.

        Lazy evaluation is used here. Values are set to -1 whenever the geographic position is modified and then computed once when a value is requested.

      • layerId

        protected int layerId
        Index of the current layer

      • tessid

        protected int tessid
        The index of the tessellation of the current position.

      • linearCoefficients

        protected java.util.ArrayList<gov.sandia.gmp.util.containers.arraylist.ArrayListDouble> linearCoefficients
        The interpolation coefficients that apply to the containing triangles. nTessellations x 3. For each tessellation, the 3 elements are normalized to 1.

      • vertices

        protected java.util.ArrayList<gov.sandia.gmp.util.containers.arraylist.ArrayListInt> vertices
        The indexes of vertices in the 2D grid that will be involved in the interpolation of data. There is a separate set of vertices for each tessellation in the model. When linear interpolation is used each ArrayListInt will generally have 3 vertex indexes, corresponding to the indices of the corners of the enclosing triangle. If the interpolation point corresponds almost exactly with a vertex, then the list will only contain one element. When higher order interpolation is used (natural neighbor), then each list may have more than 3 vertex indices.

      • hCoefficients

        protected java.util.ArrayList<gov.sandia.gmp.util.containers.arraylist.ArrayListDouble> hCoefficients
        The interpolation coefficients that will be involved in the interpolation of data. hcoefficients and vertices must be the same size. The values stored in hcoefficients[i] must be normalized such that they sum to 1.

      • radialIndexes

        protected java.util.ArrayList<gov.sandia.gmp.util.containers.arraylist.ArrayListInt> radialIndexes
        An nVertices x nNodes array where nVertices is the number of vertices involved in horizontal interpolation and nRadii is the number of nodes in the current Profile that are involved in the radial interpolation. Each element is the index of the node in the Profile that should be queried to find a data value.

      • radialCoefficients

        protected java.util.ArrayList<gov.sandia.gmp.util.containers.arraylist.ArrayListDouble> radialCoefficients
        An nVertices x nNodes array where nVertices is the number of vertices involved in horizontal interpolation and nRadii is the number of nodes in the current Profile that are involved in the radial interpolation. Each element is the radial interpolation coefficient that should be applied to the nodes in the current Profile. Note that these coefficients sum to one in each Profile. They must be multiplied by the horizontal interpolation coefficient for the vertex to get the total weight of each node.

      • radialInterpolatorType

        protected gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType radialInterpolatorType

      • model

        protected GeoTessModel model
        A reference to the 3D model that holds the model information that this position object will interrogate.

      • grid

        protected GeoTessGrid grid
        A reference to the GeoTessGrid.

      • profiles

        protected Profile[][] profiles
        Get references to grid objects that will be used a lot in the triangle walking algorithm.

      • gridVertices

        protected double[][] gridVertices

      • gridTriangles

        protected int[][] gridTriangles

      • gridEdges

        protected Edge[][] gridEdges

      • gridDescendants

        protected int[] gridDescendants

      • layerTessIds

        protected int[] layerTessIds

      • nLayers

        protected int nLayers

      • radiusOutOfRangeAllowed

        protected boolean radiusOutOfRangeAllowed
        If this is true, and a radius is specified that is below bottom layer or above top layer, then values at the bottom of bottom layer or top of top layer are returned. If false, errorValue is returned.

        public static GeoTessPosition getGeoTessPosition​(GeoTessModel model)
                                          throws GeoTessException
        Static factory method that returns a GeoTessPosition object that uses linear interpolatorin in both the horizontal and radial dimensions.

      • getGeoTessPosition

        public static GeoTessPosition getGeoTessPosition​(GeoTessModel model,
                                                 gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType horizontalType)
                                          throws GeoTessException
        Static factory method that returns the desired type of GeoTessPosition object. If the horizontal InterpolationType is LINEAR, then the radial interpolation type will be linear as well. If the horizontal InterpolationType is NATURAL_NEIGHBOR, then the radial interpolation type will be CUBIC_SPLINE.
        Parameters:
        model - the GeoTessModel from which values will be extracted
        horizontalType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.NATURAL_NEIGHBOR
        Returns:
        a GeoTessPosition object.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • getGeoTessPosition

        public static GeoTessPosition getGeoTessPosition​(GeoTessModel model,
                                                 gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType horizontalType,
                                                 gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType radialType)
                                          throws GeoTessException
        Static factory method that returns the desired type of GeoTessPosition object.
        Parameters:
        model - the GeoTessModel from which values will be extracted
        horizontalType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.NATURAL_NEIGHBOR
        radialType - either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.CUBIC_SPLINE
        Returns:
        a GeoTessPosition object.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • getGeoTessPosition

        public static GeoTessPosition getGeoTessPosition​(GeoTessPosition gtp)
                                          throws GeoTessException
        Static factory method that returns a new GeoTessPosition of the same horizontal and radial interpolation types using the same GeoTessModel. Note that the position of the new interpolator is not set and must be set by the caller.
        Parameters:
        gtp - The GeoTessPosition object for which a new one is created of the same interpolation types and using the same GeoTessModel.
        Returns:
        A new GeoTessPosition of the same horizontal and radial interpolation types using the same GeoTessModel.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

        Perform a deep copy of the contents of gtp into this. This method is called by deepCopy and copy() methods of the derived type to copy the GeoTessPosition fields of the input (gtp) into this GeoTessPosition.
        Parameters:
        gtp - The GeoTessPosition to be copied into this GeoTessPosition

      • update2D

        protected abstract void update2D​(int tessid)
                          throws GeoTessException
        Update the 2D vertices and horizontal interpolation coefficients. Different types of interpolators will handle this differently.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • getInterpolatorType

        public abstract gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType getInterpolatorType()
        Retrieve the type of interpolation that this GeoTessPosition object is configured to perform. Either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.NATURAL_NEIGHBOR
        Returns:
        the type of interpolation that this GeoTessPosition object is configured to perform. Either InterpolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.NATURAL_NEIGHBOR

        Returns:

      • getGradient

        public void getGradient​(int attribute,
                        boolean reciprocal,
                        double[] gradient)
                 throws GeoTessException
        Retrieve an interpolated gradient for the specified model attribute. If the gradient has not been pre-computed for any profiles contributing to the interpolation result, then they are evaluated here using the reciprocal flag setting. If they were pre-computed then the reciprocal flag is ignored.
        Parameters:
        attribute - The attribute index for which the gradient is interpolated.
        reciprocal - The reciprocal flag used to evaluate any undefined gradients for profiles used in the interpolation.
        gradient - The interpolated gradient is written here.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • getGradient

        public void getGradient​(int attribute,
                        int majorLayerIndex,
                        boolean reciprocal,
                        double[] gradient)
                 throws GeoTessException
        Retrieve an interpolated gradient for the specified model attribute. If the gradient has not been pre-computed for any profiles contributing to the interpolation result, then they are evaluated here using the reciprocal flag setting. If they were pre-computed then the reciprocal flag is ignored.
        Parameters:
        attribute - The attribute index for which the gradient is interpolated.
        majorLayerIndex - The layer id for which the gradient is set.
        reciprocal - The reciprocal flag used to evaluate any undefined gradients for profiles used in the interpolation.
        gradient - The interpolated gradient is written here.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

        public void getWeights​(double dkm,

        Returns the influencing node weights at the current position.

      • setModel

        public boolean setModel​(GeoTessModel newModel)
                 throws GeoTessException
        Replace the model that currently supports this GeoTessPosition object with a new model. For this to work, the new model and the current model must use the same grid.

        The benefit of calling this method is that if the application needs to interpolate a value at the same geographic position in multiple models that share the same grid, then the walking triangle algorithm and the calculation of geographic interpolation coefficients do not have to be repeated.

        Parameters:
        newModel - model that is to replace the currently supported model.
        Returns:
        reference to this GeoTessPosition object.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException - if the new model and current model do not have GeoTessGrids that have the same gridID.

      • set

        public GeoTessPosition set​(double lat,
                           double lon,
                           double depth)
                    throws GeoTessException
        Set the interpolation point to specified latitude and and longitude in degrees and depth in km below the surface of the WGS84 ellipsoid. This method will perform a walking triangle search for the triangle in which the specified position is located and compute the associated interpolation coefficients.

        This method is pretty expensive compared to the other version of setPosition where the position is specified as a unit vector and a radius.

        Assumes WGS84 ellipsoid.

        Parameters:
        lat - in degrees.
        lon - in degrees.
        depth - below the surface of the WGS84 ellipsoid in km.
        Returns:
        reference to this GeoTessPosition object.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • set

        public GeoTessPosition set​(double[] uVector,
                           double newRadius)
                    throws GeoTessException
        Set the interpolation point. This method will perform a walking triangle search for the triangle in which the specified position is located and compute the associated 2D and radial interpolation coefficients.
        Parameters:
        uVector - the Earth-centered unit vector that defines the position that is to be set.
        newRadius - the radius of the position, in km.
        Returns:
        reference to this GeoTessPosition object.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • set

        public GeoTessPosition set​(int layerId,
                           double lat,
                           double lon,
                           double depth)
                    throws GeoTessException
        Set the interpolation point to specified latitude and and longitude in degrees and depth in km below the surface of the WGS84 ellipsoid. This method will perform a walking triangle search for the triangle in which the specified position is located and compute the associated interpolation coefficients.

        This method is pretty expensive compared to the other version of setPosition where the position is specified as a unit vector and a radius.

        Assumes WGS84 ellipsoid.

        Parameters:
        layerId - the index of the layer of the model in which the position is located.
        lat - in degrees.
        lon - in degrees.
        depth - below the surface of the WGS84 ellipsoid in km.
        Returns:
        reference to this GeoTessPosition object.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

                      throws GeoTessException
        Retrieve the index of the major layer in which radius resides.
        Throws:

      • getInterfaceIndex

        public int getInterfaceIndex​(double radius)
                      throws GeoTessException
        Retrieve the index of the major layer in which radius resides. If radius < radius of first layer, returns 0. If radius >= the surface of the model, returns the index of the outermost layer that has finite thickness.
        Parameters:
        radius -
        Returns:
        int
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • getInterfacesPerLayer

        public int[] getInterfacesPerLayer​(double radius0,
                                   double maxSpacing)
                            throws GeoTessException
        Returns an int[] of length = to number of major layers. Each element is the number of evenly spaced nodes required in that layer in order for the node spacing to be <= maxSpacing (in km). The first element is at the smallest radius (near center of earth) and the last element is near the surface. Within a layer, there will be a node at both the top and bottom of the layer. This means that there will be two nodes for each major layer interface.

        Layers below the layer containing radius0 will have value 0. Layer that contains radius0 will take into account that nodes will start at radius0.

        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • getRadiusTop

        public double getRadiusTop​(int layer)

      • setMaxTessLevel

        public void setMaxTessLevel​(int layerId,
                            int maxTessLevel)
                     throws GeoTessException
        Set the maximum tessellation level such that the triangle that is found during a walking triangle search will be on a tessellation level that is no higher than the specified value. Default value is Integer.MAX_VALUE-1.
        Parameters:
        layerId -

        Throws:
        GeoTessException

        Parameters:
        layerId -
        Returns:
        current value of maxTessLevel

      • getLayerDiscretization

        public int[] getLayerDiscretization​(double maxSpacing)
                             throws GeoTessException
        Returns an int[] of length = to number of major layers. Each element is the number of evenly spaced nodes required in that layer in order for the node spacing to be <= maxSpacing (in km). The first element is at the smallest radius (near center of earth) and the last element is near the surface. Within a layer, there will be a node at both the top and bottom of the layer. This means that there will be two nodes for each major layer interface.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • getLayerRadii

        public double[] getLayerRadii()
                       throws GeoTessException
        Retrieve the radii of all the layer interfaces in km. The returned array has nLayers+1 elements. The first element is the radius of the bottom of the deepest layer and the last element is the radius of the top of the shallowest layer.
        Returns:
        the radii of all the layer interfaces in km.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • getRadius

        public double getRadius()
        Retrieve the radius of the current position, in km. This is the radius that was specified in the most recent call to one of the set() methods.
        Returns:
        the radius of the current position, in km.

      • getDepth

        public double getDepth()
        Retrieve the depth of the current position in km. This is the depth that corresponds to the radius that was specified in the most recent call to one of the set() methods. Assumes WGS84 ellipsoid.
        Returns:
        the depth of the current position in km.

      • getRadiusConstrained

        public double getRadiusConstrained()
                            throws GeoTessException
        Retrieve the radius of the current position, in km. If radius is constrained to a specific layer, and the radius specified in most recent call to a set() method was outside the range of the specified layer, then the radius of the top or bottom of the layer is returned.
        Returns:
        the radius of the current position, in km.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • setRadiusConstrained

        public double setRadiusConstrained​(int layer)
                            throws GeoTessException
        Resets the radius of the current position, in km, if out of range of the input layer. If radius is constrained to a specific layer, and the radius specified in most recent call to a set() method was outside the range of the specified layer, then the radius of the top or bottom of the layer is set as the current radius. The new position (or old, if not set) is returned on exit.
        Parameters:
        layer - The input layer into which the radius is contrained.
        Returns:
        the radius of the current position, in km.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • getDepthConstrained

        public double getDepthConstrained()
                           throws GeoTessException
        Retrieve the depth of the current position in km. If radius is constrained to a specific layer, and the radius specified in most recent call to a set() method was outside the range of the specified layer, then the depth of the top or bottom of the layer is returned. Assumes WGS84 ellipsoid.
        Returns:
        the depth of the current position in km.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • nextLayer

        public int nextLayer​(int majorLayerIndex,
                     double minThick)
              throws GeoTessException
        Retrieve the index of the first layer above the specified majorLayerIndex that has finite thickness. If there is no such layer, the value of nLayers is returned.
        Parameters:
        majorLayerIndex - int
        minThick - double
        Returns:
        int
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • getLayerId

        public int getLayerId​(double radius)
               throws GeoTessException
        Retrieve the index of the layer that contains the specified radius. If radius is less than bottom of model, returns 0. If radius greater than top of model, returns nLayers-1. If all layers have zero thickness, returns nLayers-1.
        Parameters:
        radius - in km
        Returns:
        the index of the layer that contains the specified radius.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • getErrorValue

        public double getErrorValue()
        If any calculated value is Double.NaN, then functions like getValue() or getRadiusTop() or getRadiusBottom() will return this errorValue. The default is NaN, but it can be set by calling setErrorValue();
        Returns:
        current value of the errorValue.

      • setErrorValue

        public void setErrorValue​(double errorValue)
        If any calculated value is NaN, then functions like getValue() or getRadiusTop() or getRadiusBottom() will return this value. The default is NaN, but it can be set by calling this function.
        Parameters:
        errorValue -

      • getVertexIndex

        public int getVertexIndex()
        If the position of this GeoTessPosition obect is currently set to a location that coincides with one of the grid vertices, return the index of that vertex. Otherwise return -1. Colocation includes a small tolerance, i.e., the interpolation coefficient > 0.999999999.
        Returns:
        index of colocated vertex or -1.

      • getGeoTessPosition

        public static GeoTessPosition getGeoTessPosition​(GeoTessPosition gtp0,
                                                 GeoTessPosition gtp1,
                                                 double f)
                                          throws GeoTessException
        Creates and returns a new GeoTessPosition object whose coordinates are set to the fractional distance f on a line from gtp0 to gtp1. The new GeoTessPosition uses the same GeoTessModel and interpolator types as the input arguments.
        Parameters:
        gtp0 - The first GeoTessPosition.
        gtp1 - The second GeoTessPosition.
        f - A fraction defining on 3D point on a line that passes through gtp0 and gtp1. The new point is measured from gtp0.
        Returns:
        A new GeoTessPosition object whose coordinates are set to the fractional distance f on a line from gtp0 to gtp1.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • setIntermediatePosition

        public void setIntermediatePosition​(double[] threeDVector,
                                    double f)
                             throws GeoTessException
        Sets this GeoTessPosition to the fractional distance f on a line from gtp0 to gtp1.
        Parameters:
        threeDVector - A 3D vector acting as the second point from this positions location.
        f - A fraction defining a 3D point on a line that passes through this node and the input 3D vector. The new position is measured from this position.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • setIntermediatePosition

                                    GeoTessPosition gtp1,
                                    double f)
                             throws GeoTessException
        Sets this GeoTessPosition to the fractional distance f on a line from gtp0 to gtp1.
        Parameters:
        gtp0 - The first GeoTessPosition.
        gtp1 - The second GeoTessPosition.
        f - A fraction defining on 3D point on a line that passes through gtp0 and gtp1. The new position is measured from gtp0.

        GeoTessException

      • getGeoTessUnitVectorPosition

        public static GeoTessPosition getGeoTessUnitVectorPosition​(GeoTessPosition gtp0,
                                                           GeoTessPosition gtp1,
                                                           double f)
                                                    throws GeoTessException
        Creates and returns a new GeoTessPosition object whose coordinates are set to the fractional unit vector position f between the positions gtp0 and gtp1 (f=0 ==> unit vector = gtp0 unit vector). The radii are set in a similar fashion and the new position is set into this GeoTessPosition.
        Parameters:
        gtp0 - The first GeoTessPosition.
        gtp1 - The second GeoTessPosition.
        f - A fraction defining the amount of direction and radius to apply from gtp0 to gtp1.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • setIntermediateUnitVectorPosition

        public void setIntermediateUnitVectorPosition​(GeoTessPosition gtp0,
                                              GeoTessPosition gtp1,
                                              double f)
                                       throws GeoTessException
        Sets this GeoTessPosition to the fractional unit vector position f between the positions gtp0 and gtp1 (f=0 ==> unit vector = gtp0 unit vector). The radii are set in a similar fashion and the new position is set into this GeoTessPosition.
        Parameters:
        gtp0 - The first GeoTessPosition.
        gtp1 - The second GeoTessPosition.
        f - A fraction defining the amount of direction and radius to apply from gtp0 to gtp1.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • setIntermediatePosition

        public void setIntermediatePosition​(GeoTessPosition gtp0,
                                    GeoTessPosition gtp1,
                                    double f,
                                    int layerId)
                             throws GeoTessException
        Sets this GeoTessPosition to the fractional distance f on a line from gtp0 to gtp1, and then moves the radius to the top of the layer given by layerId.
        Parameters:
        gtp0 - The first GeoTessPosition.
        gtp1 - The second GeoTessPosition.
        f - A fraction defining on 3D point on a line that passes through gtp0 and gtp1. The new position is measured from gtp0. layerId The layer that the radius of this GeoTessPosition will be set.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • move

        public void move​(GeoTessPosition gtp,
                 double[] vtp,
                 double x,
                 double y,
                 int layerId)
          throws GeoTessException
        Move this gtp's unit vector in the direction of vtp by distance y. Then rotate the result around vtp by angle x. Set the position of this GeoTessPosition to the new position. Then set the radius to the radius of the specified layerId.
        Parameters:
        gtp -
        vtp -
        x -
        y -
        layerId -
        Throws:
        GeoTessException

      • move_north

        public boolean move_north​(double d,
                          double[] vtp)
        Compute a unit vector that is distance d radians due north of this GeoVector and return it in vtp. The current position is not modified.
        Parameters:
        d - The distance North to move (radians).
        vtp - The new position
        Returns:
        true if operation successful, false if this is already at north or south pole.
